subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] My EVP sessions
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_000D_01C9D544.AD58A510
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Most do go on SF. But some may be confused, or they can't get passed their =
sadness, or pain, or whatever else that anchors them to a spot.

Just like =
when living people hold grudges-they can't get past that hurt. So they wall=
ow in it, constantly "living" it. If they could learn to just let it go, th=
ey would be able to move on.

This is why it is so important when you are s=
till alive to get over any issues you had in the past, any wrongs, etc. It =
is also important to not get obsessed with material objects, such as a hous=
e or other possession. In essence, by becoming obsessed, you are anchoring =
your soul to that object, whether it be tangible object, or an emotion. It =
seems that it is much harder to free your self of such bindings after death=
.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: SnowfireL@... 
  To: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 9:47 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-=
ITC] My EVP sessions






  It's amazing how these people that die, stay a=
round in the same place they died, one would think they would be free of th=
e sick physical body, go exploring, or look for loved ones, why do they wan=
t to hang around an empty old building?

  In a message dated 5/15/2009 11:=
44:34 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time, w9sz.zack@... writes:




    One o=
f the most fascinating ones I ever got was recorded in the ruins of a forme=
r mental hospital. The building is shaped like an "H" and our group of abou=
t 10 people was standing in one arm of the "H" looking through the windows =
to the opposite arm. We saw a shadow moving around inside the building in t=
he other arm. We were just discussing this when a hoarse voice came in THRE=
E times on the recording and said "It's Harold Wing." This voice was not au=
dible to our ears at the time of the investigation.

    Later on, one of t=
he members of our group was able to access old records for the mental hospi=
tal and found there was indeed a patient named Harold Wing who died there o=
f typhoid fever in 1936. There is no way any of us could've known that at t=
he time and it's doubtful anyone living would've known about it at the time=
, either.

    Zack

     
    On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 9:56 AM, Frank Sumpt=
ion <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:





      Playing acrh skeptic, wha=
t value is a voice for survival evidence if you don't know who it is? How d=
o you know where it came from? Or can say beyond doubt that it's even "para=
normal"? People have millions of these voices by now. 

       F-S


      =
On Thu, May 14, 2009 at 10:12 PM, iankerry@... <ian.kerry3@ntlwo=
rld.com> wrote:




        I have been experimenting with EVP for about a =
year now (in my home) and i have captured some brilliant evidence for survi=
val.The first voice i captured was that of a little boy saying ''hello''at =
1.30 am.It was so clear that others could agree on and the voice could be s=
till heard some fifteen feet away from the recorder.I have captured other v=
oices too, just as impressive.Unfortunately i can't upload because my recor=
der is a micro cassette type.












---------------------------------=
---------------------------------------------
  An Excellent Credit Score i=
s 750. See Yours in Just 2 Easy Steps!
